de.griefed.serverpackcreator.i18n

Class LocalizationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.griefed.serverpackcreator.i18n.LocalizationManager

  • public class LocalizationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is localization manager for your application.

    To use it, firstly run LocalizationManager.init(). Then use LocalizationManager.getLocalizedString() to find the localized string in config file. All localization config files need to be stored in resources/i18n directory and be named using following pattern: lang_{language code in lowercase}_{country code in lowercase}. For example: lang_en_us.lang.

    Currently supports only strings to be used in localized fields.

      • checkLocaleFile

        public boolean checkLocaleFile()
        Check for existence of a lang.properties-file and if found assign language specified therein. If assigning the specified language fails because it is not supported, default to en_US. This method should not contain the LocalizationManager, as the initialization of said manager is called from here. Therefore, localized string are not yet available.
        Returns:
        Always returns true. Dirty hack until I one day figure out how to init Localization before UI start correctly.

      • writeLocaleToFile

        void writeLocaleToFile(java.lang.String locale)
        Writes the specified locale from -lang your_locale to a lang.properties file to ensure every subsequent start of serverpackcreator is executed using said locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale the user specified when they ran serverpackcreator with -lang -your_locale. This method should not contain the LocalizationManager, as the initialization of said manager is called from here. Therefore, localized string are not yet available.
